Description: Lip and wall sherd (mended from seven fragments) of East Greek (North Ionian) black-figured pottery bowl; root of handle to right; interior glazed save for broad reserved band near lip; decoration in added red and white, from top: white zig-zag; red band between white bands; alternate red and white dot rosettes; red band lined in white; alternate red, white and black tongues with incised outline; exterior, cream slip: at lip, between bands, frieze of tongues with dots in interstices; below, zig-zag band dotted likewise; handle zone frieze preserves back leg of probable bull, to left, followed by spotted panther, tricked out with much red and incision; to right handle zone volute and palmette; much large filling ornament; below, maeander band between bands with added red bands lined in white
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Aphrodite (Naukratis), Context Φ3, Φ4 or Φ7.
Curator's comments: From the same vessel as 1888,0601.532b-h and Oxford G119.39 (Ashmolean 759).
Bibliographic references: Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 243, no. 6)
Gardner 1888 / Naukratis II (pp. 42, 48, pl. VIII, no. 1-2)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.189)
Walter-Karydi 1973 / Samische Gefässe des 6. Jahrhunderts vor Christi: Landschaftsstile ostgriechischer Gefässe (no. 1009, pl. 124)
